definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
suburbs or outskirts/one of the five degrees of official mourning attire in dynastic China/official in charge of fields (old)
suburbs or outskirts/one of the five degrees of official mourning attire in dynastic China/official in charge of fields (old)

sentences.english: Drooping ears of rice promise another good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的稻穗预示着又一次丰收。

sentences.english: She lugged the heavy case up the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的箱子拖上了楼梯。

sentences.english: Dropping ears of rice promise another good harvest .
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的稻穗预示着又一次丰收。

sentences.english: Hanging from his right wrist is a heavy gold bracelet.
sentences.chinese: 他的右腕上戴着一只沉甸甸的金手镯。

sentences.english: A few yards away, the lilacs hung heavy in the rain.
sentences.chinese: 几码远外，丁香花在雨里沉甸甸地挂在枝上。

sentences.english: The clunky lightsaber is connected to a power pack via the tube.
sentences.chinese: 他沉甸甸的光剑，通过管子，联接着电源组。

sentences.english: Dropping ears of rice promise another good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的稻穗预示着又一个丰收。

sentences.english: My clothes were heavy, my shoes weighed a tonne.
sentences.chinese: 衣服吸了水，沉甸甸的，鞋子也好像有千斤重。

sentences.english: There were always skylarks, their songs hanging over the fields of dark gold.
sentences.chinese: 总会有云雀的歌声萦绕在沉甸甸金黄色的田野上空。

sentences.english: Under the weight of these heavy manners, let the power fall.
sentences.chinese: 受够了那些沉甸甸的重压，打倒当权派。

sentences.english: The guard clanked his heavy ring of keys.
sentences.chinese: 看守把他的那串沉甸甸的钥匙弄得丁当响。

sentences.english: My heavy luggage almost got me out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 沉甸甸的行李，搞得我气喘嘘嘘。

sentences.english: Firmly stood, but also contains a heavy responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 稳固地站着，也包含着沉甸甸的责任。

sentences.english: The boy staggered in with a heavy pile of wood in his arms.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩抱着沉甸甸的一大堆木柴摇摇晃晃地走进来。

sentences.english: Inside the box were two heavy silver hair combs.
sentences.chinese: 盒子里躺着两枚份量沉甸甸的银色发梳。

sentences.english: When he had waited long enough, he drew the net in, and saw that it was very heavy.
sentences.chinese: 他等够时间后，便收网，发现网沉甸甸的。

definition: to weigh in the hand/to estimate
full and bulging (of a pocket, pouch etc)
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
to pile up/to stack/a pile/a stack
